meanings.definition: To make something or someone appear more attractive or exciting than it really is.
meanings.sent1: The movie glamorised the life of the main character, making it seem like a thrilling adventure.
meanings.sent2: The magazine cover glamorised the celebrity's lifestyle, making it look more glamorous than it actually was.
meanings.sent3: The advertisement glamorised the ordinary product, turning it into a must-have luxury item.
meanings.sent4: Her stories always glamorised her past, painting a picture of a perfect life full of excitement.
meanings.sent5: The artist glamorised the cityscape, adding vibrant colors and lights to create a dazzling scene.

meanings.definition: To portray something in a way that makes it seem more appealing or desirable.
meanings.sent1: The fashion show glamorised the new collection, making everyone want to own the stylish pieces.
meanings.sent2: The travel brochure glamorised the exotic destination, enticing tourists with beautiful images.
meanings.sent3: The chef glamorised the simple dish, presenting it as a gourmet masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: The author glamorised the historical event, romanticizing it in the novel.
meanings.sent5: The advertisement glamorised the skincare product, promising flawless skin in just a few uses.
